thread.title: X Factor 2015: Cheryl 'respects' Mason Noise for apology
thread.title_full: X Factor 2015: Cheryl 'respects' Mason Noise for apology

title: X Factor 2015: Cheryl 'respects' Mason Noise for apology
text:
X Factor 2015: Cheryl 'respects' Mason Noise for apology X Factor 2015: Cheryl 'respects' Mason Noise for apology 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Cheryl Fernandez-Versini has said she “respects” X Factor contestant Mason Noise for his live on air apology during the latest show. 
Mason used an opportunity when talking to hosts Olly Murs and Caroline Flack on the ITV singing contest to say sorry for a since-deleted tweet he wrote about Cheryl last year that read: “How is Cheryl in the music business, let alone a judge…?” 
The 22-year-old addressed her on the show and said: “Cheryl, I’m sorry and I love you.” Mason Noise (Syco/Thames TV) 
Speaking to Good Morning Britain about the apology, Cheryl said: “Everybody says and does things in the heat of the moment, the fact that he was man enough to do that live on air, I respect him for it, and him and I will talk and, you know, he’s a super talented guy.’ 
Nick Grimshaw announced controversial choice Mason as his first finalist on the live Judges’ House results show, but the loud booing that accompanied Mason to his seat made it evident he was not a popular choice with the crowd. 
He was joined in Nick’s final three by Seann Miley Moore and Che Chesterman, who Cheryl said she believed could be a potential threat to her category, the groups. Che Chesterman (Syco/Thames TV) 
“I think Che Chesterman has an out of the park voice, vocally, but I’m not worried, I’m bringing the A-game, we’re going all out,” she said. 
Rounding off the final twelve acts for the live shows are Bupsi, Anton Stephans, Max Stone, 4th Impact, Alien Uncovered, Reggie n Bollie, Louisa Johnson, Lauren Murray and Kiera Weathers. Share article 
See Cheryl’s exclusive interview on Good Morning Britain on October 29. Promoted Stories
